definition: (of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to

sentences.english: skin exposure due to severe burns after the period.

sentences.english: Also, skin doctors warn people to be careful with sun exposure .

sentences.english: Please wear a hat to protect your head against the sun.

sentences.english: Stay at home and don't expose your skin to the sun.

sentences.english: This soy paste is made of sundried and fermented soybeans.

sentences.english: Do not let mattess had insolated long, lest make, bed face fades.

sentences.english: Insolate ageing of meeting hurried skin, give birth to cancer even.

sentences.english: How to insolate to you just can make the skin bleachs quickly afterwards?

sentences.english: How come they persisted in that despite rain, storms, and sunburn?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他们能够坚持，哪怕风吹雨打与暴晒？

sentences.english: Good. Discolouration may occur in sunlight exposure.

sentences.english: Before you tell me off for being uncooperative, obstinate, or lazy, ask yourself if something might be wrong with me.
sentences.chinese: 也许我吃的东西有问题，或者在外面暴晒了太久。

definition: to dry (of weather, paint, cement etc)/desiccation/dull/uninteresting/arid
